Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: scuber
Reviews.Content: Not that that is saying it was the Ritz, but I was concerned about what we might have gotten ourselves into. Room was clean, a bit outdated....actually quite outdated, but CLEAN, beds not all that comfortable, but CLEAN. Desk staff very friendly and the breakfast restaurant very accommodating. You can't expect upper end and still have a nice time. Clean, friendly and reasonably priced accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Must have gotten oldest rooms.....”
Reviews.Author: SixInTheFamily
Reviews.Content: My husband, I & our twin daughters (14 yrs) flew into San Diego on a late flight a few days before my convention started. We chose to stay in the Travelodge for two nights as it looked nice on the internet, was close to Seaworld & seemed easy to locate. We did not arrive until midnight on a Thursday...desk clerk was none to friendly. The room we were given was in the building closest to the road---was terribly noisy & rooms looked nothing like the photos on the internet. The carpet was torn, tub didn't drain well so you stood in water as you showered & the light above the vanity too about 30 minutes to come on. Since we were only there for two nights, it was okay for the price (internet was free, while the hotel we stayed at for my convention charged for internet--go figure!). I would just recommend that you ask for a room in one of the other sections...they must be the ones that are shown on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Starman99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 11 nights last month whilst getting away from the UK for some winter sun. Having stayed here for a similar period in 2010 we were again not disappointed with our choice of San Diego or the hotel. We inadvertently booked a room without a fridge; however, the General Manager provided us with a fridge complimentary saving us $100+ which was a nice touch. The room was of a good size and standard, as before, with a powerful shower to match. The in-room safe managed to lock with our valuables in and refused to open; however, a call to reception brought the maintenance man who opened the safe and replaced the batteries within 10 minutes of calling! Ate at Adams Steak n Eggs (onsite) most mornings for breakfast and the food and service was superb as before. Ate at Albies Beef Inn (onsite) once – the food was ok but either the menu has changed or the range of choices was not as good as we remembered it! Pool was good, clean and warm; especially for mid-January. The only complaint this time was the location of the room. Last time we stayed in the block at the back of the property which runs parallel to the freeway and this seemed to have minimal road noise; however, this time we were located in one of the side blocks near the very front of the property which was very noisy at times from both the traffic and other inconsiderate guests! I am sure we could have asked for a room change but didn’t! Overall, a good stay again and we will back later in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: Mom4904
Reviews.Content: This motel had clean, comfortable rooms for an excellent price, in a very good location. If you just need a good place to stay and plan to spend most of your time away from the motel, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marpy72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 weeks and found it to be an excellent value (we found a special that worked out to less than $55/nite). Yes, the rooms and carpeting/furnishings/tv are old, but our room was large, with a clean, comfortable bed, a comfy upholstered chair with reading light, a desk, free wifi, and all was kept very clean by the great housekeeping staff. We wake early so the rolling housekeeping carts did not bother us, but I suppose they could be annoying to later, lighter sleepers. The maintenance people were also very friendly and helpful. We were given a room toward the back and we usually use earplugs anyway, so were not bothered by noise, except for a couple nights due to noisy neighbors above us. It was nice to have windows at both the front of the room and the back so we could enjoy a lot of natural light. The heated pool and huge hot tub were very clean and the decks provided a nice area to enjoy the beautiful weather. We chose not to pay extra for the micro/frig, but were happy to have use of them in the common area which also included a convenient, reasonably-priced laundry with comfortable lounge seating. We were very impressed by all the staff members, and any requests we made were handled within minutes. The office area was being remodeled while we were there and it is looking very nice. Parking was free and there was easy access to and from the hotel. At the rates we received, we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Low budget - somewhere between a hotel and crack house”
Reviews.Author: dolldetails
Reviews.Content: We did a last minute walk in at 2am and found them to have free parking, no deposit, and be about $5-10 cheaper then all the other low budget hotels on the street. We asked for a quiet room. #227 upstairs was ok. Paid $110.26 for 2 nights with tax. Now- with the name your price if you are smart enough to plan the day before, for $60 offer you can stay in a ritzier place. The sink is clogged so it starts to overflow and fills up with water quickly. Either hair clog or someone dumped something in it on purpose. Could cause a flood, they should fix that. The shower and bathroom were bleached clean. The beds were great. Nice and firm. Soft clean sheets smelling like bleach. The television was HORRIBLE so you if you love TV, this is not the place. We were watching the NFL playoffs. The do no disturb sign comes off the door, so bring scotch tape. We did get woken up. There was a cold draft from a 1940's window coming in from the bathroom. Ask for another blanket or shut the door. Clean shower with good water pressure. Stairs, I did not see an elevator. Sandpaper ratty towels Spacious room, and we felt ok. We have extensively traveled the world and stayed in all star places. This was average and adequate. Don't bring anyone you want to impress. As with most drive up motels, the maid card rolls by loudly waking you up. Bring earplugs The neighbors ask where they can locate Mary Jane, and there is probably human trafficking going on. It is a decent safe area, so don't be afraid to walk around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: hmbay
Reviews.Content: We made a long road trip from SF to SD for Holiday Bowl and just needed a place to crash for 2 nights without the wives. Wouldn't have picked this place if the wives had been with us. Rooms were Ok for the price (about $69/nite inc tax). Perfectly adequate for us but two nits. At 6am the first night some sort of cleaning truck pulled up to the restaurant for about 20 minutes. The second night my neighbor got amorous to the point of the bed banging the wall in the middle of the night. Cliched but true. So we didn't get a lot of sleep either night and weren't in the best of shape for the long drive home.

Reviews.Title: “yikes talk about scary!!”
Reviews.Author: may0529
Reviews.Content: Pictures do lie. When we went on the website they showed us brand new updated rooms with big nice beds with spacious bathrooms. LIES!! We were placed in a room near the stairs that was far from what the pictures promised us. Our bed was rock hard and I felt like I needed someone to crack my back after being on there for ten minutes. The bathroom was beyond disgusting and I seriously felt that our safety was in jeopardy. The door had a huge gap on the bottom that people kept throwing trash and fast food ads under. We ended up having to seal the bottom of the door with towels just to elminate the noise and trash. The only good thing is the big hot tub. But thats just about it. Never was I so happy to check out from a hotel. Next time I'll just stay at the hilton or the marriott in the same area. At least theres a better sense of security. I go to San Diego every month for both work and vacation. never again will i stay here

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but good for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Wellina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with two young kids. The rate was great for us and the room was big with two comfortable queen beds, a safe, WiFi and coffee maker. Within the motels premises there is a guest laundry room, microvave oven in a "kitchenette", free parking and a pool. The staff was friendly and helpful. A few steps down the road there is a bus stop for bus 88 that takes you to more buses (down town etc) and to the trolley. The only thing that I really disliked was that houskeeping started making noice at 8AM when they pushed their trollys outside the room. The motel does not offer breakfast, however there are two diners right next to the reception that do and there is a Starbucks in one of the neighbouring hotels. So if you want a quite, spotless, nicely decorated and modern hotel, this i nothing for you, but if you are not too fuzzy and are looking for a cheap please to sleep at, I can recommend Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shineanthology
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a convention in the Town & Country and decided to stay in the Travelodge in order to save money. Nice hotel, especially if you -- like me -- only need it for sleeping and showering, and good value for money. Also a compliment to the staff who took off one night from the bill when I had to check out a day earlier than planned.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Gem”
Reviews.Author: Frndlyfamily
Reviews.Content: Keep up the good work and also love the prices. It's wonderful to know that you offer AAA discount and only wish others were able to accomodate like you have especially with the economy as it is. We need to get away every now and then and want to do so more often if prices were reasonable like your hotel. Thank you and hopefully we can afford to get away soon. Good work and great job on everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise !”
Reviews.Author: palmgirl93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge from 10/6 - 10/12 and were pleasantly surprised ! We were nervous after reading some reviews , but had a great deal for flight and lodging ( from MN) through Travelocity and decided it was worth any potential risk . Check in was a breeze ... we chose to stay with our standard room ( no fridge or microwave ) but were told that for $10 daily , we could "upgrade" .... we figured we'd be out of the room more than in it so declined that option. (note: There is also a small meeting room that had both a fridge and microwave that could be used by anyone in the motel ) We had an upstairs room , away from the road and never struggled with "vehicle noise " . Our room was large , clean , and well kept ...... the beds were very comfortable as were the pillows and the housekeeping was fantastic ..... we always had more coffee , towels , etc. We very much enjoyed the use of the large hot tub after a busy day exploring San Diego ..... never used the pool , but noted that it was cleaned each morning , had plenty of chairs for lounging ,etc. Another "bonus " of the Travelodge was the 2 restaurants and bar on site ..... there is a happy hour M-F that had drink specials and snacks ..... the bartenders are wonderful and fun to talk with ....in addition , we had the chance to enjoy the piano bar one evening ....... that was AMAZING ! We walked in as MN tourists and left feeling like part of a family ..... the piano player was fantastic both at the piano playing and the singing as well as including everyone in the bar to join in , sing along , etc...... FANTASTIC . We would be more than willing to return to this motel and are , in fact , working on getting another couple to join us for another San Diego / Travelodge vacation with us ! One last thing ......... the hotel circle area is easy to navigate , and within 5-10 minutes or less to most attractions ..... there is a stop for the trolley tour right in front of the motel as well . Beth and Jim

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellone
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised when I check into my room. It was very clean and nice. The bed was very comfortable. If you are on a budget this is the place to stay. Close to very thing. I would stay here again. The only thing I would say to the hotel is buy some ashtray that hang on the wall or the post. They are only $30 or so and would make the grounds nicer. They where butts every where since there was few place to put them. I used a cup with water to put my butts in, since I could not find an ashtray anywhere. But other then that it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Canyon and San Diego Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Trent C
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and it was pretty much as expected from reading other reviews.Checkin was effortless as I had booked through Travelodge and as I had requested ,received a room on the upper floor and away from highway. The room itself was average, looked nice but carpet was stained and looked a little dirty, the room had the mini fridge as I had requested, one of the windows would't close properly. The biggest problem I had with the room was that there was no venting in the bathroom,so when you took a shower you either had to open the window(which my wife and daughter were not comfortable with, no curtain) or when done showereing, open the door which let the steam and heat into the room. We were very pleased with laundry facilities used them twice. maid service was excellent, they gave us pool towels to take to the beach with us and even folded our blankets that we had brought with us. Overall a pleasant stay,good location, very economical, was charged exactly what was quoted. Sidenote WIFI worked well and was free but to use computer in laundry area $2.49 per minute.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE FOR THE MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: mgannon2011
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to restaurants, attractions, the room was very clean and comfortable, courteous staff, free internet, HBO. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful bugdet hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindy g
Reviews.Content: if your on a budget and would perfer to spend your money on the sites of san dieago instead of more exspensive hotels then this is the hotel you want! it is located minutes from sea world, SDzoo and old town, and mission beach! The rooms are old, but clean and modest, the price is great! The staff was very friendly and the pool area was wonderful too.. The hotel does warn about ordering foods from flyers that are shoved under your doors...DO NOT ORDER THE PIZZAS OR FOODS FROM THE FLYERS!!! NASTY TASTING FOOD!!! Other than that, I would stay again on my nest visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: JDM637
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite basic, but they are absolutely fine, very clean. It's in a great location, outside the city centre, but close to major attractions. 5 minute drive to Balboa Park/zoo, 10/15 minutes to La Jolla and Mission area, and a 10 minute walk to the trolley stop which takes you to all the main stops in downtown, and even to the border to Mexico if you had planned to go that far. Pool area is nice. And there are restaurants/taverns and a little shop all down the same road as it is a hotel orientated area. Perfect to suit most needs unless you're after a luxurious resort!

Reviews.Title: “what can I say there wasn't a shower curtain horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Eric D
Reviews.Content: This motel had horrible customer service there was no refrigerator in room or microwave or shower curtain or coffee maker when I took paper from priceline showing them the ammenities promised they told me that it was innacurate and that I could get a refrigerator for an additional $10 a night. When I told them no they would put a microwave and fridge in room for free they did put a refrigerator in but said that there were no microwaves available. They said I could use the microwave in the laundry room. Then I tried using there internet service in the laundry room and they tried charging for it another ammenity listed that was a lie. The pictures for this motel make it look much better than it is and the customer service was horrible. It was great location as all hotels on hotel circle are, but I would recommend staying at a different one there. The rooms were decent size and about what was expected for a cheap motel if I had been treated better by the staff it would have made this stay much better. Oh also the safe didn't work I didn't ask them to fix this because of the earlier experience I had and the window opener stuck at times.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, rooms need renovation”
Reviews.Author: HaimBadash
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two ngts. Our hotel room was old and not the most cleaned one. However the quality of the staff was a great compensation. The room furniture's have seen better days, The hotel location is very comfortable and enable easy access to all major locations. For the price they charged it seems reasonable but I must admit that Motel 6 across the street offered better price with the same quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: arodgers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a full week, and this was a great place to stay. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for an affordable hotel with a great outside pool and whirlpool. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and ready for us right when we got into town. San Diego is a wonderful city and this hotel helped us to enjoy the whole week. Enjoy the view from the pool area-AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great staff perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: babeandme
Reviews.Content: We had two joining rooms in July, we stayed there 3nights and let me tell you, I have have no complaints! The rooms I inspected right when we got there and found nothing wrong. Our rooms were comfortable, clean and the staff was helpful that is good enough for me! We will absolutely stay here again on our next trip to SD!

Reviews.Title: “We love the staff and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Frndlyfamily
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Travelodge every time we have been in San Diego in the last 12 years. We have been extremely satisfied. The restaurant has very good food and the employees treat you very well. In fact we have stayed there so often they even remember us. We will indeed stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T LET THE BED BUGS BITE!”
Reviews.Author: AJ9847
Reviews.Content: I was here for Comic Con. And if you remember the review I wrote a couple years back about the Holiday Inn I stayed at, then all I can say is....All is forgiven!! The title speaks for itself. I was bitten bu bed bugs, and not just a few times either, more like 100 times. So severe were my bites that I ended up wearing long sleeves for most of my trip. I was uncomfortable, itchy, sore and hot. Sure the hotel staff apologized, were nice, and moved us, comped me and my friend $150 each for the 'inconvenience' but I feel that's just not enough. I'm seeking legal action. Just make sure you check the room first. But, I wouldn't recommend a place that doesn't change the bedsheets every single day (I found stains one morning, probably from where I was bit, and they were still there when I got back that night!) The place obviously has hygiene issues. Do, however go to Adams Steak and Eggs next to the Travelodge lobby! Nothing to do with Travelodge though. Super breakfasts and really awesome staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: CherylR31
Reviews.Content: In town for Comic Con, so the room rate was high, but so was every other place I checked. The location was convenient for downtown as well as area attractions. The staff was friendly. The room was clean, beds comfortable. There was a guest laundry with reasonable prices. Several restaurants within walking distance, but the best were right on the property. Albie's Beef Inn was wonderful. It's retro and cool. I wish I had discovered it earlier in my stay. I felt like I had gone through a time warp. Loved it. Not my first comic con, but the best hotel experience I've had in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck...this place is gross. One of the worst places I have stayed.”
Reviews.Author: genora05
Reviews.Content: Our first glance of the property was not bad. The desk staff was accommodating and very helpful. Once we checked into our room our opinion of the Travelodge changed. The room was an eyesore. The colors on the walls did not even match and did not look like anything that was advertised on the website. Mold was starting to grow on the bathroom walls and ceilings because there was no ventilation fan. A window in the bathroom had to be opened that barely opened and closed. Each time we opened it we were afraid that we wold not be able to get it locked again. The room smelled like a strange cleaner.....like something was being covered up. The staff was accomodating when we asked to change rooms, but the room that was offered reeked like cigarettes. Although the paint decoration was better we could not stay in a room that had so clearly been smoked in regularly. The property was covered with cigarette butts, garbage, beer and soda cans that had obviously been there for a long time. They need to hire property maitenance staff that cleans the grounds daily. cigaregtte butts were stuck inside the stairs and littered around the pool and spa. The Cabana area that looks so nice on the website was dirty and covered with garbage most of the time we were there. GROSS! We requested a room on the top floor in the back of the property and felt safe and secure during our stay. I will attach pictures to show how dirty the property was. Also, I desperately needed to use the guest laundry facilities but they closed at 8:00 to be locked for the evening. I decided to start the load the following mornin at 9:00 am and was informed that it it not unlocked unitl 11:00 am. Who does laundry during those hours on vacation? We were checking out that day and could not wait! Also......it costs $3.50 per load to wash and dry. Very spendy if you can make it during the open hours. We will not be staying in this location again and will probably never stay in another Travelodge if this represents their standard. See attached pictures :(

Reviews.Title: “Wont go back!”
Reviews.Author: luis1mm
Reviews.Content: I was not satisfied my family and I stayed from June 26 - July 1 2011. As soon as we walked in I seen my wifes face she was not happy I was not happy. The walls were dirty the bathroom was awefull and the carpet was so dirty that my son just playing and walking barefoot on for about 20 min his feet and knees were black it was also sticky. I guess thats why they use dark carpet to hide it all. I do like the area and the staff was very friendly and helpfull. I think with updating the bathroom a little,coat of paint and washing that carpet at least once a month it will be fine. My wife said she wont be having me book our Hotel for vacation anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: mholtz25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. The clerks at the front desk are helpful and our room was clean and spacious. However, it got pretty noisy at times with people having parties in their rooms. Also, it's kind of in a poor location. In order to get anywhere, you have to call a taxi or wait for the bus. (We didn't have a car with us.) The bus is fine, but you have to time it just right because they run about every 30 minutes. It became very tiring to constantly transfer buses to get anywhere due to how far out we were. If this hotel was closer to attractions, I would've given it a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good on a budget but you need a car if you're staying here”
Reviews.Author: LeonieF88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was a good hotel if you're on a budget. It cost around US$65 per night. It was in a safe area, the rooms were clean and tidy, the staff were helpful. There is a nice outside hot tub/spa pool as well as a swimming pool. It has free wi-fi, a little diner/restaurant and a laundry. You would need a car if you stay here though as it is a little way from the city centre, nightlife, restaurants etc Only about 10 mins drive but its definitely not in walking distance to anywhere as its by the freeway. If you're looking for a clean, tidy, safe hotel on a budget and you have a car then I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pipearl
Reviews.Content: Hotel front desk is nice. Hotel room when you first open it is very musty with odor. I was ashamed to bring my sister and brother in law from Germany to this hotel. The bath tub and sink in my room was always slow to drain. The sink seemed clogged up all the time. Room carpet feels wet and musty!! I would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average place to get by cheap”
Reviews.Author: Shortjud
Reviews.Content: I really wasn't thrill with this place at all! I was afraid of getting bed bugs because it wasn't really spotless. There were too many college kids in this place and me being from Jersey I felt I was in the Jersey shore crowd. The wifi was so hard to get into and it just didn't fit our criteria. It is in a good location but if it's just for one night it's ok I guess but not for a whole week.

Reviews.Title: “The best part is the breakfast place next door.”
Reviews.Author: ld1244
Reviews.Content: did not get to try the adjoining steakhouse, but will guess it was decent, based on the streak i got with my eggs. the room is very sparce, unattractive, a bit noisy with an over all flimsly feel. parking is free (yay) and hotel is centrally located on hotel circle, surrounded by what are probably better places, ever though my $57/night prices seems on the low end for . non-smoking room clearly smelled of smoke and also because the wall heater did not work, they changed our room

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: CC161
Reviews.Content: The rooms themselves were exactly what you need, a bed to sleep on, working tv and bathroom. The hotel is situated on the hotel circle, which isnt too expensive to get to Seaworld, Downtown or the Zoo. The room was clean and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: volver2011
Reviews.Content: Carpets were damp and sticky. Bed was lumpy and the pillows were small square pillows the were as lumpy as the bed. Room was cleanish. Back of bathroom door had I don't know what on it. Shower had mildew. Just very uncomfortable. Pool didn't look anything like the hotel photos. Ironing board upon request was small table top version that was so filthy and the iron had scorch marks on it. But this wasn't the worst hotel I've stayed in. The staff was friendly and we received clean towels/bedding everday.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: alittlemoss
Reviews.Content: Check-in was easy and quick, even though we arrived late at night. The room we were assigned was dirty, and since they were otherwise booked solid we were given a handicapped room at the front of the property. There was not a good seal around the door, so road noise creeped in though I donâ€™t think that would be much of a problem had our room been further back. Parking space was tight coming back late at night on the weekend, but was ample during the day and during the week. The dÃ©cor was dated and dingy (what you would expect at this price point) and the smell a bit musty, but the bed was comfortable, the television had plenty of channels and the heating/AC worked well. We were pleasantly surprised by the free wi-fi, heated pool and micro/fridge in our room, and we found ourselves returning to the attached restaurant a few times. For the price, we would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good place, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MakotoNet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. This Travelodge is located in a avenue with many hotels and it is a very quiet area. It has a good location near to some shopping malls and very easy to go to San Diego downtown, but you will need a car to go to the places, I would not recommend it if you dont have a car. I recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: gaps33
Reviews.Content: Check actual hotel website for special deals, we arrived on a Tuesday and stayed 5 nights in upgraded King with fridge/micro for $350. Easy access to all of San Diego, no free breakfast, but great little restaurant on site. Second restaurant only open for dinner, great steaks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Value”
Reviews.Author: Gram_E_10
Reviews.Content: 2 wks. babysitting a todler & newborn during the day made this hotel a convenient, inexpensive oasis at night. The staff (including Josna, Yolanda & Tellie) were wonderful, supplying extra towels for our grandson's occasional afternoon in the pool & hot tub. Old fashioned restaurant (Albie's) with piano bar is a throw-back with great steaks. Have already recommended to other family members who will be visiting "the kids" during the next few weeks. Early AM delivery and garbage trucks interrupted morning sleep-in but otherwise, a quiet place just off I-8 with easy access to downtown, Balboa Park and other local sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Affordable Room!”
Reviews.Author: MarcSanchez
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Travelodge in Mission Valley during my Labor Day weekend stay. The location was central and close to everything I wanted to check out in San Diego and the room for the price was unbeatable. The women in the front were extra courteous in arrangin a cab during my stay and there is also a great restaurant near the lobby if you want to grab a quick bite!

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: rjsingleton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, greeted by friendly staff when checking in, rooms are very spacious and clean and the beds are extremely comfortable! No complaints what so ever as I am planning my next trip to San Diego and will look no further than Travelodge for my hotel accomidations

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL SAN DIEGO VACATION”
Reviews.Author: rendezvouswithyou
Reviews.Content: I live in Las Vegas and spent a one-week vacation in San Diego. I stayed at the Travelodge in Mission Valley, which is a pet-friendly place, so I was able to bring my little Dachshund with me. The Travelodge is located in a great area which is centrally located to many of the sights, and the accommodations were nice. The staff at the Travelodge were very accommodating and friendly. I would consider staying there again on my next vacation. Thanks to Richmond, Tellie, Yolanda, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at the Mission Valley Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: SS3838
Reviews.Content: I had an awesome stay at the Mission Valley Travelodge. My room was very clean and every single employee (from the front office staff to the cleaning crew) was so polite and friendly. I will definitely stay at this location again!

Reviews.Title: “very basic”
Reviews.Author: bigrockelk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the recommendation of a friend. The front desk staff was friendly and the room was clean although very dated. The bedding appeared to be new but this hotel is old and the furniture was very worn and probably from the eighties. The bathroom did not have a fan. The pool and hot tub were very clean. The room does not include a complementary breakfast but there is a restuarant on the premises. We had an excellent breakfast at Albie's. The food and service were very good. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a cheap overnight stay but definitely not if you are staying for more nights. I think you could spend a few more dollars for a hotel with a complimentary breakfast and a more updated accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “NO COMFORT HERE”
Reviews.Author: mission43
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! The room was one of the least expensive in hotel circle. The pics look great. But it stops there !!!!! The beds were hard and tilted to the edge. We had an ant problem in the bathroom the faucet had a slow stream of water. The freeway noise and parking was terrible. The workers at the nearby restaurants used the hotel room parking, making it very difficult to find a place. Unsavory looking people seemed to roam the place. You can't have a good time if you don't get a good nights sleep. Do not stay here if you want to enjoy your vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel to relax and feel comfortable”
Reviews.Author: john52551
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 4 different weeks since last september and are very pleased! Rooms are very clean,staff extremely courteous and helpful.Swimming pool and jacuzzi are perfect and relaxing.A few times we asked for some extras like refrigerator and microwave and someone brought it to our room within 5 minutes!! Compimertary USA Today paper each morning. Hotel manager Richmond was fantastic, as always! Upgraded us with flat screen HD TV in our room. great location,we will come back again!we love the free Wi Fi too!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay near the ocean”
Reviews.Author: ritaeknox
Reviews.Content: service was great through out: front desk, restaurant, housekeeping. Room was fine. No special features. Free wifi access was unexpected and appreciated. Location is 5 minutes from the beach. Pet-friendly is why I stayed here and would stay again, with or without my dog.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was just "OK"”
Reviews.Author: teamspears2010
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here one night because a friend was having a birthday party in San Diego. The location and customer service were great but our room....eh, not so much. The pictures on the site definitely do not give a true depiction of how old the rooms look. We weren't expecting a 5 star style appearance but MAN!...our room looked like a face-lift was in order. The worst was this: I generally make it habit to flush hotel toilets prior to using to ensure they are in working order. Thank God I did too...it backed up. To the motel's credit, as soon as I called the front desk, a handyman came within 15 minutes to fix the issue. The toilet still had a slow flush and since we were only there one night, we figured we could handle it. We probably won't be staying here again as there are probably better hotels for a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: “Web Site Is A Total Lie!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gracie1454
Reviews.Content: As soon as i walked into my room old worn linen,moldy filthy bathroom....food caked on remote....terrible smell i sneezed the entire night... thank god i was there with my dog,,,,vagabonds walking through lot..... i had to leave ,looks like somewhere you would take a prostitute....my dog even hated it! Trust me don"t be surprised like i was... its a total DUMP!

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back....”
Reviews.Author: HuntTheWumpus
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to this Travelodge for the past 10 years and it NEVER gets old!! More times than not, it's been for the SD Gay Pride Festival but a few times a year, I come just to get away from LA....I've never had a problem with the facility or the people....Funny thing is, many of them in Adam's Steak and Eggs (the adjacent diner) remember me from year to year.....Great parking, clean rooms, quiet location, I love it....as long as there is a pride celebration, Travelodge has my vote!!

Reviews.Title: “Real good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RogerBEngland
Reviews.Content: Over from UK stayed here for 4 days.Rooms were clean and tidy ,and for what we paid very good value. Both on site resteraunts gave excellent breakfasts and everning meals. The staff were very attentive to all our requests and questions( us not always understanding the American way of doing things) Location was good for the trolly bus service and also as a base for our trips to the zoo and Corranado We would certainly rcomend this place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mounty47
Reviews.Content: Arrived 3.15pm with no problems with checking in as we noticed that checking in time was 4pm. Rooms light and airy, nice comfy bed. Reception very efficient and helpful. Lovely clean swimming pool. Whole place very clean. Would recommend anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Lower end hotel that needs plenty of improvements”
Reviews.Author: bleubox
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, many parking spaces Cons: No elevator (two-story structures), outdated looking rooms, stayed in a "business room" which looked like a typical low end room, a/c conditioner in bad condition, no bathroom fan, some wall electrical outlets in bad condition, no continental breakfast at this property even though travelodge website says all hotels do, restaurant on property that sells breakfast is overpriced for the budget traveler and costs less at Denny's down the road

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: persnickety81
Reviews.Content: Everything this hotel promises is a lie. On their website AND over the phone they claim that a trolley stops right in front of the hotel. I don't consider a 20 minute walk and crossing a freeway as "right in front of". I didnt bring a car because I was told by front desk staff that it was within walking distance of everything and the trolley would take me downtown. Lies! As for the rooms, I booked a "suite". It was completely lame. I couldve gotten much better hotel, much closer to downtown for what I paid for this. Plus, the front desk staff was uniformly uninterested in being helpful throughout the whole trip. Whenever they were asked a question, they would give you whatever question would get you off their back instead of being helpful. And the travelodge website says free breakfast, but they do not offer any breakfast at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: koolcat69
Reviews.Content: My family and I were at a Comfort in Chula Vista and decided to move after a night due to the poor location. This place was great for the price! It is located close to all the attractions we wanted to go to and it had a nice heated pool we relaxed in at night. The city Trolley Tour picked us up right in front of the hotel and that is also highly recommended. The clerk told me they recently changed management and had been working on improvements. After looking at other reviews here, it seems she wasn't kidding. The rooms were big, clean, and ours came with a fridge. The lounge on the property had a great happy hour and nightly entertainment. The only negative is the bathroom could use some updates and a continental breakfast would be nice but no big complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel722
Reviews.Content: Perhaps one the worst hotel experiences ever. The front desk clerk was rude and arrogant. When I asked to speak with a manager she stated she was the GM even though her name tag had no title. That was the start. Our room was dirty, the place smelled like stale swamp water. Our toilet didn't work, when I called to complain to the front desk a woman answered, (I assume the same one who checked us in) she hung up on me. One can only hope that in this economy that hotels like this will go out of business. If you stay there expect nothing but bad customer service, shabby, dated and dirty rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Mediocore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WIBadgergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights while visiting San Diego. Got this hotel on Hotwire and have to admit I was disappointed. Reviews were not good so we didn't have much for expectations. We were in a room close to the freeway so had a hard time sleeping because of the constant vehicle noise - thank goodness I brought ear plugs which helped somewhat. Rooms are very much in need of attention - not in cleaning but in general repair. Peeling paint, torn carpeting, etc. Towels were like sand paper and very thin. On the plus side the on site restaurant Adam's Steak and Eggs served an EXCELLENT breakfast! We ate there a couple of times because it was that good and the service was great. You get what you pay for and at $53/night that's exactly what we got - not much!

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: maresa02
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay near the airport before an early flight the next morning. We found it but have stayed in cheap places before that were better than this place. The door barely shut and latched----we could see daylight. The TV picture was poor at best. We killed an interesting.........bug on the floor and one in the bed. The room has been painted and repainted many times and the screens on the windows were warped and illfitting. I would not want to spend much time in this room.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was going well until...........”
Reviews.Author: deandownunder
Reviews.Content: Everything was going well until I got hit for extra fees on checkout. My Expedia prepaid voucher included an extra child accom. charge but I was told that did not include a rollaway bed. The rollaway was another $10 plus tax per day. I was also charged for use of the room safe which was not used, however this charge was later removed. The desk staff whilst polite were very inflexible and not exactly very friendly.The room was .small and very worn however it was clean which was the main thing. The onsite breakfast restaurant was excellent but the other evening restaurant was not as good and reasonably pricey. The other thing that annoyed me about this place was that I was told I could have had my accommodation MUCH cheaper if I had booked directly with them. I have nothing but the highest regard for Expedia and for this establishment to infer I could have saved money going direct is beyond belief.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: rrruby
Reviews.Content: Not bad! I usually don't like hotels with exterior corridors. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was big, comfortable, and reasonably quiet. Very clean. Not enough towels, but a quick phone call and towels arrived. Be sure to tip! It makes a difference! I had a terrible flight to San Diego, and the staff let me use their fax machine, took care of my late-arriving luggage, and generally made sure I had a good hotel experience. They were really wonderful. Location is easy to get to. Plenty of parking. Directions to area attractions available at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jerrycee1955
Reviews.Content: Room kept clean, bedding spotless. Breakfasts at on-site restaurant excellent, as was the service. The dinner restaurant was spoiled for me by the piano and singing from the bar area, but this was obviously very popular with locals judging by the numbers using it. Very convenient location for freeway access to Seaworld, the Zoo and the Wild Animal Park. Historic Old Town is also very close and there is easy access to the Trolley system for cheap travel to/from Downtown, although parking at the Old Town station was tricky to find, being very well used. A Travelodge is just a Travelodge after all, so don't expect to get five-star hotel treatment. Another reviewer comments on the room safe charge: I was asked to sign a clause on the registration form saying that there would be a daily charge at the end of my stay if I used the safe. I was asked if I had, (truthfully) said no, and was not asked to pay anything. Great for somewhere to base yourself for travelling in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_girl2
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to be able to find a hotel, we had left it to the last minute and every hotel we went to was full, so when this was the only one available I was worried but it turned out to be great. The restaurant was really nice and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “a good base to explore San Diego, that's about it”
Reviews.Author: gwwyjjliu
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very dated, and the room decor and fixtures show it. However, the room is very spacious and the staff are friendly and helpful. Best part of this hotel is its location, close to everything in the heart of Mission Valley. For the price, it's a good value - just don't spend any time in it other than to sleep and it will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel--great restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: boxingnun7158
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late in reviewing this place, but thought that I needed to defend it after reading so many terrible reviews. I should note that I am not the pickiest of people when it comes to motel/hotel rooms. As long as it is clean and safe, I'm basically happy. I stayed at this motel in a king bed room for 5 nights. The room seemed clean enough and I thought the bed was comfortable. Our room wasn't right next to the freeway, so the noise didn't bother me (I should mention that I am super sensitive to noise, so the fact that I didn't hear anything at all is impressive). The decor was basic motel decor--nothing I would decorate my house with, but not overly depressing or dated. The window in the bathroom was a little strange, but it never became a problem. I found the front desk staff to be very friendly and accomodating. We were able to buy Sea World tickets at the front desk, which saved us a long wait in line. This motel is also centrally located. We walked to the Fashion Valley mall for food and to catch the train to Old Town (which is definitely worth a look--very cute and great food choices!). It was about a mile, we just cut through the Town and Country Resort (where our conference was held). The only real negative to this motel was the pool. It wasn't heated and the hot tub was only luke warm. Pool seemed clean enough though. The best part of this motel is the breakfast restaurant, Adam's Steak and Eggs! Incredibly cheap--I never paid over $8 and on average only spent about $6. Fresh cream for coffee, everything tasted homemade, and the corn pancakes were the best I've ever had. I'm actually very picky about food (unlike motel rooms) and really, this was great food. The Pam-Pam restaurant up the street (connected to some other hotel, but I can't remember which) is also pretty decent for late night, standard "American" cuisine. All in all, the rooms are fine. They were cheap and suited our needs perfectly. Remember, this is a Travelodge, not a Hilton. Regardless of whether you stay at the motel or not, I would recommend Adam's for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing doesn't begin to describe this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The carpet was wet, the bathroom was dirty, the blankets had stains on them, the water in the bathroom sink was backed up and there were flys in the room. When I complained to the management, they encouraged me to check out and find another hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK. It was what we paid for. Don't expect the front desk to help at night as they are closed. The rooms were clean and kept clean. We did have to call for them to fix our shower which they immediately did. Be aware that they charge you for the use of the in room safe whether you uise it or not. We rented two rooms for 5 nights and were charged a total of $16.60 for safe use, which we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: larryFridley_MN
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, bright, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. While it's a little tricky and inconvenient to get in and out of, it really is in a great location: right on the freeway, easy to get downtown, to Old Town, to the Zoo and other attractions. While there is nothing but motels in the immediate area, it's a short drive to a nice neighborhood with good businesses, restaurants and shops. This was a good value and we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star location for this Two Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie042
Reviews.Content: For a two star, the place was clean, towels were decent and best of the all the bfast place was one of the best spots i have ever been to. Great value for your money and close to great shopping and sea world. Great location. If you are on a budget, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really want to give this motel a "terrible" rating but you pay for inexpensive accomodations and that's exactly what you receive. I guess they give you what you pay for so in that respect alone, it's not "terrible". The place is in an excellent geographical location, again warranting better than "terrible", but pretty worn-out and didn't have a clean feel at all. The furniture is beat-up and dirty looking. The floor lamp had a stained shade. (How does this happen? Did a prior guest have a food or drink fight?) The lamp had obviously fallen over several times and the pole was bent and crooked. The front desk wasn't exactly inviting. The clerk at check-in obviously would have rather been anywhere but waiting on us. When we checked out in the morning, they had signs hand-written in blue marker all over the front windows warning people that there was no vacancy: "No Vacancy, Means No Vacancy", "We have NO Singles, Doubles, or Even a Broom Closet!!" The signs were rather terse and inconsiderately worded. I found them rather offensive. Based upon the signs alone, I would not return even with a reservation and I certainly wouldn't stay at another Travelodge if that is how they feel about their future guests; that they are a big bother. Maybe they should have invited the inquirers in to see if they could put them up at another Travelodge in the area. Instead, they were just chased away. The room appeared clean but upon closer inspection, it became obvious that it wasn't. We found used tissues between the bed headboard and the wall and found a piece of jewerly on the floor next to the bed. This leads one to believe that they don't vacume the carpet. If they had vacumed, they would have found the jewelery or at the very least sucked it up with the vacume cleaner. Therefore, I refused to walk anywhere without shoes. I began to wonder what else they didn't clean. Did they clean the bathtub, toilet or even wash the sheets? What kind of bacteria is growing in the swimming pool? The air conditioner vents were all broken and/or missing and the unit was so noisy and vibrated the window above it so badly that we couldn't even use it the first night. Since we were so hot the first night, I finally had to take the window screen out the second night and adjust the metal casement window in order to keep the rattling to a bearable level. In addition, the rental car bus storage facility directly behind our room spewed diesel fumes into the room when they warmed up the buses in the morning. The general noise level at the motel is also very disturbing. Constant loud talking, slamming of doors, and banging on the walls next door. We had a stranger knocking on our door in the middle of the night along with a phone call from another guest who couldn't figure out what room her friend was in. All-in-all, I wouldn't recommend this motel unless you don't care about cleanliness, noxious fumes or noise. However, if you are on a really, really tight budget, it might suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “good and cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: generally for a two star hotel, it was very nice. the rooms were clean. but don't let the bed bugs bite though. lots of parking space. the place was close to the nice spots in SD. the place was cheap for a weekend stay. always sold out.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge San Diego Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 1201 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
